p: At days 0, 7, and 15 the mice were euthanized and fat graft specimens were placed in zinc-formaldehyde and used for histological and immunofluorescence examination. Afterwards they were either embedded in paraffin or in gelatine. Sections of 7 µm thickness were cut and stained. We used the following primary antibody for immunofluorescence: Anti-MS2 antibody ab255608 (abcam, Berlin, Germany), Anti-Osteopontin antibody ab8448 (abcam), and Fatty Acid Synthase (C20G5) Rabbit mAb (Cell Signalling Technology, Frankfurt a. M., Germany). As conjugated secondary antibody, we used Alexa Fluor 555 (both Cell Signalling Technology).
